Magnetization plateaus and the susceptibilities of a nano-graphene sandwich-like structure
Wei Jiang*, Ya-Ning Wang, An-Bang Guo, Ying-Ying Yang, Kai-Le Shi School of Science, Shenyang University of Technology, Shenyang 110870, China
a r t i c l e i n f o
Article history: Received 21 June 2016 Received in revised form 22 August 2016 Accepted 3 September 2016 Available online 4 September 2016
* Corresponding author. E-mail address: weijiang.sut.edu@gmail.com (W. J
http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.carbon.2016.09.007 0008-6223/© 2016 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
a b s t r a c t
Ising model with the anisotropy is abstracted based on a nano-graphene sandwich-like structure. The system consists of a ferromagnetic middle layer and two antiferromagnetic layers on the top and under the bottom. Multiple spin states are employed to the analysis of magnetic behavior for graphene-like molecules. The effective-field theory with correlations has been successfully applied to this, and the general formula of the magnetic properties for the nano-graphene sandwich-like structure is obtained. Results of numerical calculation for the magnetization and the susceptibilities are discussed for specific values of the external magnetic field. Magnetization plateaus appear on the magnetization curves at low temperature. The exchange coupling, the anisotropy and the external magnetic field have important roles on the magnetic properties for the nano-graphene sandwich-like structure.

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text:
Recently, multiple spin state is applied to analyzing magnetic mechanism for nano-graphene-like molecules. This is the first successful method applied to analyzing ferromagnetism. The highest spin state (S¼ 3/2) corresponding to the lowest energy ismore stable based on density function theory and molecular orbital calculation. And the analysis indicates up and down spins are alternatively arranged one by one. So C48H24 graphene molecule shows an antiferromagnetic exchange coupling between spins [1]. In C59N5H22 molecule five unpaired electrons make possible multiple spin state (S ¼ 5/2). And up and up spin pairs may have stronger exchange coupling, namely it is a ferromagnetic exchange coupling between spins [2]. Based on the spin-3/2 nanographene described by an Ising antiferromagnetic model, the magnetic properties of the system are studied by Monte Carlo simulations. The magnetizations, magnetic susceptibilities, hysteresis cycle and blocking temperature of a nanographene with the effect of exchange interaction and the external magnetic field are obtained [3]. A nano-graphene bilayer structure is described by bilayer Ising ferromagnetic and antiferromagnetic model with mixed spin-5/2 and 3/2. The magnetic behaviors such as the magnetization, the transition temperature, the magnetic susceptibilities, the hysteresis loops and blocking
iang).
temperature have been investigated bychanging various parameters. The variation of magnetization versus the temperature for a nanographene bilayer is given in detail [4e6]. In our previous work, we have studied magnetic properties of a nano-graphene bilayer. Mixed Isingmodel is abstracted to describe the nano-graphene bilayer. One of layers is an antiferromagnetic exchange coupling with spin 3/2, whereas the other is a ferromagnetic exchange couplingwith spin 5/ 2. The effective-field theory with correlations has successfully been applied to the magnetization, the magnetic susceptibilities and the blocking temperature for the nano-graphene bilayer [7].
A great breakthrough of the carbon-based functional materials has been made, and sandwich-like carbon sheets as an enhanced cathode in lithium-ion batteries have been successfully synthesized [8]. The sandwich-like nanocomposite is reasonably believed to have a great potential for multiple electrochemical energy storage applications. It inspires us to study physical properties of a nanographene sandwich-like structure in theoretical. In addition, Ising model as an elementary model in statistical mechanics has been explained the magnetic and electric polarization behavior. The effect-field theory (EFT) is one of the methods to solve the problem. It has been successfully applied to solve a variety of spin or pseudospin Ising problems [9,10], especially nanometer materials in recent years [11,12]. We also have studied magnetic properties of nanoparticles, nanoscale films, nanowires and nanotubes on the basis of Ising model and the EFT [13e17]. The results proved that the anisotropy and the exchange coupling are important in the magnetic system [18e20]. Thus, the purpose of this paper is to study the
effects of various parameters on the magnetic behavior of a nanographene sandwich structure. A sketch of the geometry of the studied system is plotted in Fig. 1. The top and bottom layers are the same, which is the antiferromagnetic exchange coupling Ja(<0) with spin s ¼ 3/2. The middle layer is the ferromagnetic exchange coupling Jb(>0) with spin S ¼ 5/2. Jab(>0 or <0) is the exchange coupling between two layers.
The paper is arranged as follows. In Section 2, Isingmodelwith the anisotropy is proposed to describe a nano-graphene sandwich-like structure. In Section 3, the magnetization plateaus and the susceptibilities of the system are investigated. Finally, Section 4 the summary is given.

sections.heading: 3.3. Effects of the anisotropy on magnetic properties
sections.text:
The effect of the anisotropy is of particular importance in the magnetic properties. The magnetization M and M1, M2, M3, M4 as the function of the magnetic field is plotted in Fig. 8 (a)e(b) for selecting the anisotropy Da ¼ 1.4 and 3.2. The other parameters are fixed as Ja ¼ 0.4, jJabj ¼ 0.8 and Db ¼ 1.6. In Fig. 8(a) curvesM also have three magnetization plateaus M ¼ 7/6, 9/6 and 11/6. The saturation magnetic field are hs ¼ 7.1 and 10.7 for Da ¼ 1.4 and 3.2, respectively. From Fig. 8(b) the sublattice magnetization M3 and M4 are also always M3 ¼ M4 ¼ 5/2. For the weaker anisotropy Da(such asDa ¼ 1.4) the spin states on the top (or under the bottom) layer of the nano-graphene sandwich-like structure may take±3/2,±1/2. However, it may take 3/2,±1/2 for the stronger anisotropy Da(such as Da ¼ 3.2). This is due to the system would be stay at the low spin state for the stronger anisotropy. The effect of the anisotropy Da on the critical and saturation magnetic field is plotted in Fig. 9. hs increases linearly with the increase of jDaj.
However, hc2 first decreases and then increases with the increase of jDaj. The maximum and the minimum appear on the hc1 curve. The temperature dependence of the susceptibilities is plotted in Fig. 10. The parameters are fixed as Ja ¼ 0.4, jJabj ¼ 0.8, and h ¼ 0.5. The solid lines are the case of Da ¼ 0.5, 1.8, 3.5 and Db ¼ 1.6. The blocking temperature shifts to high temperature with the decreasing jDaj. The blocking temperatures are at TB ¼ 6.69, 6.56 and 6.32 for Da ¼ 0.5, 1.6, 3.5 (Db ¼ 1.6), respectively. However, the blocking temperature is becoming lower TB ¼ 1.43 for Da ¼ 0.5 and Db ¼ 3.5 (dash line). It shows clearly that the behavior is different from those of case Db ¼ -1.6 (solid lines). This phenomenon is due to the system would be stay at the low spin state for the stronger anisotropy Db.

sections.heading: 4. Conclusions
sections.text: In this work, a nano-graphene sandwich-like structure is described as Ising model with mixed spin 3/2 and 5/2. The general formula of the magnetization for the nano-graphene sandwich-like structure is given by the effective-field theory with correlations. The effects of the exchange coupling and the anisotropy on the magnetization and the susceptibilities of the system have been studied. The total averagemagnetizations at low temperature show themagnetization plateaus, which come frommultiple spin state in the nano-graphene sandwich-like structure. The blocking temperatures are sensitive to the exchange coupling and the anisotropy, which can be determined by the position of the susceptibility maximum. The magnetization curves appearance of a broad maximum maybe the release from frustrated state, due to the thermal agitation. This is in agreement with the experimental.
